main event: An unknown object was sighted over Hillsboro, Oregon on 4 June 1949.
interesting points: The object appeared metallic, large, and round in shape, comparable to a 3/8 inch diameter object held at arm's length,The object wobbled slightly but remained in a fixed position for about 3 minutes,It then moved in a Southwesterly direction at high speed,Observers noted no sound or exhaust trail associated with the object,Weather conditions during the sighting were clear with good visibility and bright sunshine.
witness description: Middle-aged employees of the Wolf Creek Highway Water District, Cedar Mills, Oregon
